subject: Ethics
title: Drone Warfare Ethics
description: A fast breakdown of Drone Warfare Ethics for builders.

hook.text: A pilot in Nevada eats lunch, then kills a man in Yemen by remote control. He's home for dinner.

buildup.text: Military drones let operators strike targets thousands of miles away with zero physical risk to themselves.

discovery.text: Proponents argue drones are more precise than bombs. Fewer civilian casualties, in theory.

twist.text: But studies show drone operators still suffer PTSDâ€”watching kills on a screen doesn't erase the trauma.

climax.text: Distance makes war easier to start. When soldiers don't die, the political cost of conflict drops.

punchline.text: War without risk isn't peace. It's just cheaper violence.

quiz.question: What is a key ethical concern about drone warfare?
options: Drones are too expensive for military use
Reducing risk to soldiers makes starting wars politically easier
Drone operators never experience psychological effects
